Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Allopurinol in Neonates with CCHD Undergoing Cardiac Surgery

Trial_Design.evidence: Fourteen neonates with prenatal CCHD diagnosis were randomised

Participants.evidence: Fourteen neonates with prenatal CCHD diagnosis

Intervention.evidence: randomised to receive either allopurinol or placebo

Objective.evidence: investigating the effect of postnatal and perioperative allopurinol on postoperative brain injury

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the pharmacokinetics (PK) of allopurinol and oxypurinol, measured over the preoperative, intraoperative, and postoperative phases.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed by Ace Pharmaceuticals using blocking, and allocation was concealed.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding included outcome assessors, patients, and clinicians.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Fourteen neonates with prenatal CCHD diagnosis were randomised

Result_Outcome.evidence: A two-compartment model for allopurinol and a one-compartment model for oxypurinol best described the PK.
